POR.DRECONTENT:
This project explored connections between p-adic heights and p-adic (Coleman) integrals, tools from non-archimedean analysis used to study curves. These methods aided in our investigation of various important arithmetic invariants of curves. Moreover, we were further able to use these methods to develop explicit techniques to find points with integer coordinates on certain curves -- in particular, elliptic and hyperelliptic curves.

During the course of the project, we produced new ways to compute quantities of interest in the study of the arithmetic of curves. This has resulted in new algorithms for p-adic heights, p-adic regulators, p-adic L-functions, and p-adic integrals.  These algorithms have allowed us to formulate and to produce evidence for a generalization of the p-adic Birch and Swinnerton-Dyer conjecture for modular abelian varieties of higher dimension.  Other algorithms have led us to a better understanding of the relationship between p-adic heights and p-adic integrals and the applications they have for the arithmetic of curves. By translating p-adic heights into quantities involving p-adic integrals, we were led to a method to find integral points on certain elliptic and hyperelliptic curves. We were able to use this method in practice; we explicitly found integral points on such curves in several examples.
